meanings.definition: The state or quality of being uncongenial.
meanings.sent1: The uncongenialities between them made it hard to work together.
meanings.sent2: She tried to avoid the uncongenialities at the family gathering.
meanings.sent3: The uncongenialities in the office led to some awkward moments.
meanings.sent4: The uncongenialities in their relationship created a wall between them.
meanings.sent5: The uncongenialities in the room were palpable, making everyone uncomfortable.

meanings.sent1: He packed his bags, leaving behind all the uncongenialities of the past.
meanings.sent2: The uncongenialities in the group dynamics were causing tension.
meanings.sent3: The uncongenialities in the menu made it hard to choose what to eat.
meanings.sent4: The uncongenialities in the air were thick with unspoken resentment.
meanings.sent5: The uncongenialities in the atmosphere were suffocating, making it hard to breathe.
